summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for August 10, 2019. It details the irregular observation schedule for inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation. The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and Captain.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed and signed off on the 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: A senior officer who also reviewed and signed off on the 30-minute check sheets.

events.title: Inmate Monitoring in MCC SHU
events.description: Routine 30-minute observational checks of inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous locked-down status.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing 30-minute observational checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The checks were conducted on an irregular schedule, with observations required at least twice per hour and no more than 40 minutes apart.
The log is dated August 10, 2019, which is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at MCC New York.
The document was reviewed and signed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The log covers multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the Special Housing Unit, indicating it was a standard procedure for the entire unit.
